ranked_diseases.explanation: This disease is characterized by sensorineural hearing impairment and delayed speech and language development, aligning closely with the observed phenotypic features.
Usher Syndrome Type 1 is associated with congenital sensorineural hearing loss and progressive vision loss, which may correlate with delayed speech and language development.
This syndrome includes hearing loss and developmental delays among its features, potentially explaining the sensorineural hearing impairment and delayed speech.
Pendred Syndrome results in sensorineural hearing loss and can be associated with developmental delays, which may match the speech and language delay.
